ygData.subject: Re: Help
ygData.msgSnippet: The 6-month time period is a myth. Your characters and their info are kept indefinitely in their servers unless they go cleaning it out for space which I
ygData.messageBody:
The 6-month time period is a myth. Your characters and their info are
kept indefinitely in their servers unless they go cleaning it out for
space which I highly doubt since your files are miniscule in size.
I've had a number of friend who have left for over a year (one for 3)
and have returned with everything intact. The only catch is it make
take some time to re-activate your account after extremely prolonged
inactivity. :) So there is no way you can leave for a year, then come
back and not get your account back. Of course if you were banned or
suspended, then that is another issue, or your credit card is maxed
heh. :)


--- In EverQuest@yahoogroups.com, Melanie Johnson <melanie_6602@y...>
wrote:
>
> Not really trying to argue here but I have canceled my account 3
different times for RL things. Granted, the longest time I was away
was only 4 months. But when I logged back on, all was well. Nothing
moved, no gear missing... I litterally did pick up where I left off.
> Maybe accounts that go inactive for a year or more can have
problems though.
> Su <suceress@k...> wrote:
> > > Second off, old accounts can NOT be reactivated just like that.
> > > EverQuest holds onto your unused and unpaid for accounts for six
> > > months before deleting it.
> > No, they guarantee they won't delete accounts for 6 months, but
they
> > have never yet actually deleted an inactive account. I know of
several
> > people who have returned after a year or more and just
reactivated their
> > account
> > Matt
